Articles.Content: This is probably my favorite mod.  Any word on if this will be brought up to date?

On 7/22/2020 at 3:35 PM, xman1 said:

This is probably my favorite mod.  Any word on if this will be brought up to date?

Whilst I love that to happen I'd have to say that won't happen for a LONG TIME. People have lives and there is a global pandemic that we'd all love to forget about that is ruining everyone's lives. Just be patient and there'd might just be an update coming out. Maybe a few months but that's an optimistic approach at least. The mod still works with the newest version though but with some bugs that can be overshadowed for the "average" player.

Can someone point me to where in the configs I would edit the following?  I have SVE with EVE+Scatter loaded.

The line between light and dark as kerbin orbits and transitions to night is too sharp.  I'd like to diffuse the edge point a bit so it doesnt look like a blanket of darkness is being placed over kerbin or a super storm is on the horizon.

I know its a setting in either scatter or eve or both, but instead of tinkering trial and error, if someone knows the settings to touch, please share.

Screenshot of the edge of night:
Does this mod still work with 1.10.1? Thanks.

51 minutes ago, 1990eam said:

Does this mod still work with 1.10.1? Thanks.

I believe that the scatterer configs for SVE are out of date for the current version of scatterer (see Galileo's post on the previous page).

First of all , fantastic mod, really amazing. Using with outerplanets mod. Its stunning

Quick question, since its not currently up to date with the jool revamp, is there a way i can remove the mod's retexture of jool? i happen to like the stock jool

 

Many thanks.

Still works like a charm, even in 1.10.1! (Installed through CKAN; had to force 1.6 compatibility).

I'm using EVE-Redux, Medium-Res Textures, and OPM, and everything works just fine.
(I'm not using Scatterer, Distant Object Enhancement, or PlanetShine, since those tax my system pretty hard).

Maybe, the planets have too much of a blue tint (particularly Laythe and Kerbin), but that's just personal preference.

I haven't run into any issues yet, so I'd say this is still a good option for anyone out there looking for a visual mod.
(I wouldn't install Scatterer, though, since the Scatterer configs are out of date and might cause problems; installing other configs alongside this is probably a bad idea too, as usual).

Cheers, @Galileo!

So, I've been playing around with SVE again, and found that it actually works great with the newest version of Scatterer in 1.10.1, despite the older configs (at least, it does on my install). Even the OPM planets work fine.

I guess this makes it my visual mod of choice for now, since it looks great and I don't need to worry about Scatterer compatibility. (It's also supported by a hefty number of planet packs, which is a nice bonus.)
Where had the development for this gone??? It looks really nice, but I want to use it in 1.10...
It works in 1.10.x. There might not be new stuff, but it works just fine.

20 hours ago, kerbalxploder said:

 I want to use it in 1.10...

It works in 1.10.x. Just uninstall Scatterer if it gives you issues.

On 11/2/2020 at 6:21 PM, Maple Kerman said:

It works in 1.10.x. Just uninstall Scatterer if it gives you issues.

On 11/1/2020 at 10:17 PM, Krakatoa said:

It works in 1.10.x. There might not be new stuff, but it works just fine.

Yeah, I'm sure it works, but imagine if there were new features and/or visual effects being added in the game as the versions increase. The progress on this mod had pretty much halted, and it has been the same way for a while now. And also, there are new things added like comets, if SVE were up-to-date, then it might be able to deal with that.

55 minutes ago, kerbalxploder said:

Yeah, I'm sure it works, but imagine if there were new features and/or visual effects being added in the game as the versions increase. The progress on this mod had pretty much halted, and it has been the same way for a while now. And also, there are new things added like comets, if SVE were up-to-date, then it might be able to deal with that.

All I know is that it works fine in 1.10.1 and also looks spectacular. That's good enough for me.

15 minutes ago, Maple Kerman said:

All I know is that it works fine in 1.10.1 and also looks spectacular. That's good enough for me.

Yeah, I guess so. Regardless, I don't want to torture my GT 1030 any further than high stock graphics settings does, so I guess I will be holding off until I get sth better.
I've seen old YouTube videos using this mod and Jool has very defined lines plus rings. How do i get that effect and what version do I have to be on?

On 11/14/2020 at 11:39 AM, Drupegod02 said:

Jool has very defined lines plus rings

I don't know what you mean by "defined lines". As for rings, you need Kopernicus for SVE to add rings to Jool.

On 11/18/2020 at 12:01 PM, Maple Kerman said:

I don't know what you mean by "defined lines". As for rings, you need Kopernicus for SVE to add rings to Jool.

What i mean is very bright and green rings. I downloaded this on 1.9.1 and jool only had thin rings

2 minutes ago, Drupegod02 said:

What i mean is very bright and green rings.

You have to make the rings yourself, then. I've never seen SVE add bright green rings to Jool.

Edited November 20, 2020 by Maple Kerman
how do you create your own?

Just now, Drupegod02 said:

how do you create your own?

I don't know. Look it up, I guess.
Any pics of the stock planets? i wanna see them before i install and i cant find any good up to date reviews
i have it running on my test install but i cant get the jool rings to work, or maybe they're too faint but i have all the dependencies and scatterer
